Citrus
plants are typically evergreen
trees
or
shrubs
with glossy oval-shaped
leaves
; many species have thorns. The
flowers
are usually white with five petals and are very fragrant. The fruits are a type of modified
berry
known as a hesperidium, and the flesh is divided into segments packed with tiny juice-filled vesicles. The peel, or rind, of the fruits is leathery and studded with oil glands.
